poem:
### Halloumi and Apricot

In the amber haze of Saturday lunch,  
a knife slides through soft apricots,  
and childhood rises in the perfume  
of a sizzling pan. Memory lingers  
in the salty creak of halloumi,  
stacking nostalgia between bread slices,  
each bite a golden bridge  
to where days never end.
